attributes.action: No breed specific legislation in Scotland
attributes.additional_details: There are more cases of animal abuse, neglect, dogs burnt, poisoned, starved, beaten, tied up, dumped or left to roam the streets. since this happened there has been 0 dog attacks. We also have major concerns over defra as they have had 0 involvement in the welfare of these animals. They also have a duty of care of pollution but have left the public to bury these dogs unaided. We believe that the dogs aren’t to blame but the people. We want an end to bsl and the right people held accountable
attributes.background:
With the recent dog attacks in England and wales, the uk government decided to ban the xl bully type dog. 

We strongly believe that this should not be the case in Scotland. 

We want to bring liscencing in place to ensure animal and public safety as well as responsible owners

rejection.details:
It’s about something that the UK Government or Parliament is not directly responsible for.

We can only accept petitions about things the Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Decisions about banning XL Bully dogs in Scotland are a matter for the Scottish Government and Parliament, not the UK Government or Parliament.

The Scottish Parliament has its own Public Petitions Committee. If you'd like to send your petition to the Scottish Parliament, you can find out more here: http://www.scottish.parliament.uk/gettinginvolved/petitions/index.aspx

We only reject petitions that don’t meet the petition standards.
